activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason M Yonker

records.addlTxt:
4:06 PM Defendant Jason M Yonker in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF176, 22CF63, 22CF82 & 22F128. Defendant waiting for appointment from PD's office. Defendant statement to ADL patch - needs to make payment. Bond continued. adj. 04:09 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:02 PM Defendant Jason M Yonker in court.  Attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Calling 22cf63,22cf128,22cf82.
PD has not yet been appointed on these matters.
Sowinski statement - defendant is now  in compliance with ADL - violation for not having patch on.  
Bail continued
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Notification Defendant is not in compliance with electronic monitoring

The defendant is required to be monitored by the SCRAM patch through ADL Monitoring Solutions before release - The defendant is ordered to contact ADL at 920-283-1038 to make arrangements - The defendant is responsible for any costs associated with the SCRAM patch.

2:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jason M Yonker not in court. Calling 22CF82, 22CF63, 22CF128, 22CM15, 22CM48, 21TR2477 & 21TR2478. Court review of case. Defendant states has contacted PD's office - statement to charges/bond. Pfeifer objects to any bond modification. Court will take under advisement - bond continued. adj. 03:05 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:54 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jason M Yonker appeared by video, in custody. Calling 22CF128, 22CF63, 22CF82, 22CM15, 22CM48, 21TR2477 & 21TR2478. 22CF128 set for an initial appearance. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - PD's office not able to appoint counsel yet in prior cases. Sowinski statement to bail - statement to prior charges. Defendant statement to Vilas/Oneida County charges. Court sets bond. adj. 02:03 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
